Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery olpe; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of panther to right (part of back, neck with added red, and face with red stripe running between ears and down nose, red eye remaining; added white spots on nose, forehead and brow) with fawn (red neck, chest and possibly ears, with body stippled with incisions) held upside down in mouth; incised spoked rosette with red alternating petals as filling ornament.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B102.23)
Beazley & Payne 1929 / Attic Black Figured Fragments from Naukratis (p. 254, no. 4)
Payne 1931 / Necrocorinthia. A study of corinthian art in the archaic period (p. 193)
ABV / Attic Black-Figure Vase-Painters (p. 14, no. 13) (incorrectly numbered as B103.23)
Johnston 1978 / Pottery from Naukratis: An Exhibition on the Occasion of the 11th International Congress of Classical Archaeology (no. 30)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 304, no. B307)
Venit 1984 / Early Attic Black Figure Vases in Egypt (p. 144, note 16)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 223, no. 11)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0298) (Phase 1)
